rComments: horrid teaching, assignments were filled with typos and confusing aspects that he does not explain very well. Marks on the assignments were deducted just purely to reduce the class average (sometimes it won't even make sense to why). For example, the handout states to not include a scale and marks were lost for not having a scale. Avoid this prof!
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read', 'Tough grader']

rComments: The first few assignments were extremely easy and we actually got guidance compared to the last few where we had no help and no instructions on what to even do. Prepare for extreme confusion.

I had a really bad experience taking this course and will probably never take another GIS course again. Everything was quite disorganized, lectures all over the place. I heard the other intro GIS course was better, should've taken that.

The TA's had completely different expectations than what the professor said during class. Lectures were all over the place, things we should have learned in the first week were taught during the last week. Take the other intro GIS course.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Tough grader', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: His classes are rather disorganized and the assignments are not well explained. The instructions and guidelines are very confusing and general, and when we asked for clarification, there were more confusion. His exams grading schemes also differ from the assignment grading. The exams are the only part of the course that the prof marks it himself.

This class is so disorganized because the prof's expectations differ from the TAs marking the labs. Additionally, he barely touches the concepts we need for the lab assignments, while explaining things that were useless for the lab. Furthermore, the marking schemes of the labs vary greatly depending on the TA (and he doesn't follow up with them).

Great teacher! Explains GIS concepts & tools so they're easy to understand (much better than the dense textbook) and answers all student questions well. His lecture explanations & GIS demonstrations are the main teaching component of this course, so you MUST go to lecture. Really nice outside class too - very accommodating.
